Package similarity

Class SimilarityMeasure

  • java.lang.Object
    • similarity.SimilarityMeasure
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChamferDistance, DiceIndex, HausdorffDistance, HybridSumOfDifferences, Intersection, NormalizedCrossCorrelation, SimilarityOperation, SumOfDifferences, WeightedMutualInformation

extends java.lang.Object

      • setBoost

        public void setBoost​(boolean activate)
        Sets whether the image comparison should be computed faster or not. If set to true the computation is faster but it may not function properly for big images with high bit depths.
        Parameters:
        activate -

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual​(Image img1,
                       Image img2,
                       int threshold)
        Checks if the images are equal or not according to a set threshold regarding all bands (all bands are compared). The comparison done is defined as: compare(img1, img2) <= threshold, where the compare function gives the score of similarity between images 1 and 2
        Parameters:
        img1 -
        img2 -
        threshold - - default is 0, in this case the image will be equal when they are exactly the same in most similarity measures
        Returns:

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual​(Image img1,
                       Image img2,
                       int band,
                       int threshold)
        Checks if the images are equal or not according to a set threshold regarding the band passed as parameter (just one band is compared). The comparison done is defined as: compare(img1, img2) <= threshold, where the compare function gives the score of similarity between images 1 and 2
        Parameters:
        img1 -
        img2 -
        band -
        threshold - - default is 0, in this case the image will be equal when they are exactly the same in most similarity measures
        Returns:

        public abstract boolean invert()
        Returns false if it is a measure like Mean Differences, Hausdorff Distance, etc, where the lower the number returned the better and returns true otherwise
